meanings.definition: The quality or state of being prickly or spiky.
meanings.sent1: The thorniness of the cactus made it challenging to touch.
meanings.sent2: I avoided the thorniness of the rose bush to protect my hands.
meanings.sent3: The kitten learned about thorniness the hard way when it tried to play near the cactus.
meanings.sent4: The thorniness of the situation made it hard to navigate through without getting hurt.
meanings.sent5: The thorniness of the hedgehog's spikes served as a natural defense mechanism.

meanings.definition: The presence of thorns or sharp points.
meanings.sent1: I felt the thorniness of the rose as it pricked my finger.
meanings.sent2: The thorniness of the plant made it dangerous to handle without gloves.
meanings.sent3: The thorniness of the bush surprised the unsuspecting hiker.
meanings.sent4: The thorniness of the barbed wire fence warned trespassers to stay away.
meanings.sent5: The thorniness of the porcupine's quills served as protection from predators.

meanings.definition: The difficulty or complexity of a situation.
meanings.sent1: The thorniness of the puzzle left me puzzled for hours.
meanings.sent2: Dealing with the thorniness of the issue required careful consideration.
meanings.sent3: The thorniness of the math problem made my head spin.
meanings.sent4: Navigating the thorniness of relationships can be challenging.
meanings.sent5: The thorniness of the negotiation process tested their patience.
